description: Linear transformations, Gauss Jordan elimination, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, theory and applications. Mathematics majors are advised that MATH 312 cannot be taken to satisfy the major requirements.
name: LINEAR ALGEBRA

values.comments:
Linear Algebra discusses linear transformations, Gauss Jordan elimination, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, theory and applications. Mathematics majors are advised that MATH 312 cannot be taken to satisfy the major requirements. Prerequisite: MATH 240.

Students expressed mixed opinions regarding this course. One student wrote that it was “excellent” and “interesting.” However, another student complained that “the work and examples [were] just in abstract mathematical terms; there was virtually no application to real world problems.” Another student stated that the textbook, was easy to read and informative.

The majority of students approved of Professor Virbhadra. The overwhelming sentiment was that Professor Virbhadra is “dedicated” to his students: he held 16 office hours per week and would go out of his way to make separate meetings with students if necessary. Many students felt that Professor Virbhadra “genuinely cares that everyone learn as much as possible.” Another student wrote, “I have never met someone so excited by teaching. His communication and accessibility were unmatched.” While most students expressed similar views, one student stated “I often found myself simply teaching myself from the book, and I know of many students who used MIT's linear algebra open course as a replacement for going to class.” 

Many students thought this class was easy, especially “after coming from Math 241.” One student stated that the material is taught slowly and is sometimes repeated.
